Name.BusinessNameLine1: NATIONAL CENTER FOR LEARNING DISABILITIES INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: ENSURE THE SUCCESS OF ALL INDIVIDUALS WITH LEARNING DISABILITIES.
IRS990.MissionDescription: NATIONAL CENTER FOR LEARNING DISABILITIES, INC. ("NCLD") MISSION IS TO ENSURE THE SUCCESS OF ALL INDIVIDUALS WITH LEARNING DISABILITIES IN SCHOOL, AT WORK, AND IN LIFE: CONNECTING PARENTS WITH RESOURCES, GUIDANCE AND SUPPORT SO THEY CAN ADVOCATE EFFECTIVELY FOR THEIR CHILD. DELIVERING EVIDENCE-BASED TOOLS, RESOURCES AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT TO EDUCATORS TO IMPROVE STUDENT OUTCOMES. DEVELOPING POLICIES AND ENGAGING ADVOCATES TO STRENGTHEN EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND OPPORTUNITIES. NCLD HAS A UNIQUE ROLE AMONG LEARNING DISABILITIES ORGANIZATIONS. WE ARE WELL REGARDED AS AN IMPARTIAL SOURCE OF RESEARCH-BASED INFORMATION. BECAUSE NCLD IS NOT BEHOLDEN TO ANY ONE SPECIFIC MEMBERSHIP OR PROFESSIONAL CONSTITUENCY WE RESPOND QUICKLY AND FLEXIBLY TO NEW NEEDS, PROGRAM INNOVATIONS AND POLICY DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES.
IRS990.Description: Education Programs: NCLD delivers programs to improve instruction, assessment and support services for those who struggle to learn, especially for individuals with LD. RTI Action Network: The RTI Action Network supports frontline educators in implementing a Response to Intervention (RTI) approach to identifying struggling learners early and providing them with interventions that they need to achieve academic success. The RTI Action Network is a coordinated effort with a core group of national partners to disseminate RTI information, tools and resources via the Web and national and regional conferences. The national partners have been selected to reach stakeholders ranging from elementary school principals and school psychologists to general education teachers and reading specialists in order to promote the effective use of RTI models. Since its inception in 2008 The RTI Action Network Web site--the principal delivery channel for information--has served more than 380,000 individuals. Over 100,000 educators have participated in the Network's professional development events at partner conferences and other venues. RTI Leadership Network: The RTI Leadership Network is a project of the RTI Action Network. The project supports district and building leaders in the effective implementation of RTI. Each participant is coached and mentored on how to proceed to get results for improved student achievement through individual on-demand contact combined with monthly group calls and online conferences. The participants also join an online community of colleagues to share ideas, discuss resources, and brainstorm solutions. Piloted during the 2009-2010 school year, we anticipate 225 school leaders who will make decisions influencing 3 million children in the 2010-2011 school year.Parents as Advocates: NCLD's Parents as Advocates program provides parents the clear, concise and accurate information and resources they need to be effective advocates for their children. As part of the program we also train a cadre of parents-a Parent Leaders team-to strengthen the national voice for children and families on Capitol Hill in Washington, D.C. These Parent Leaders are a critical part of our effort to educate policy and decision-makers about LD and families' perspectives on the issue of education of children with learning disabilities.

Activity2.Description: ESSENTIAL INFORMATION: NCLD's Web sites, online and print newsletters and interactive programs (Talks, Webinars and Online Forums) provide parents, educators, other advocates, and the media with comprehensive information. Our resource locator lists services by state. Our LD.org Web site, which serves 1 million parents and educators each year, delivers information on the legal rights of children, adolescents and adults with LD; fact sheets; resource lists; and podcasts. Interactive resources include live chats, message boards, blogs, and online forums. Our electronic newsletters serving both parents and educators have more than 50,000 subscriptions.

Activity3.Description: PUBLIC POLICY: NCLD provides leadership in shaping public policy to enhance and improve the lives of those struggling with learning disabilities. At the core of our work is an understanding and commitment to extend the privileges and protections provided for by federal laws to the learning disabilities community. Our policy work has positioned NCLD to influence public debate, raise awareness for critical issues and enhance the overall visibility of those working on learning disability issues. Our work in Washington D.C. focuses mainly on the reauthorization of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act (ESEA), the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA) and the related regulations that follow.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Donor restricted net assets for program expenses.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: On July 1, 2009, NCLD adopted the accounting standard accounting for uncertainty in income taxes, ("ASC 740," formerly FASB Interpretation No. 48), which addresses the determination of whether tax benefits claimed or expected to be claimed on a tax return should be recorded in the financial statements. Under this guidance, NCLD may recognize the tax benefit from an uncertain tax position only if it is more likely than not that the tax position will be sustained on examination by taxing authorities, based on the technical merits of the position. The tax benefits recognized in the financial statements from such a position are measured based on the largest benefit that has a greater than 50% likelihood of being realized upon ultimate settlement. The guidance on accounting for uncertainty in income taxes also addresses derecognition, classification, interest and penalties on income taxes, and accounting in interim periods. Management evaluated NCLDs tax positions concluded that NCLD had taken no uncertain tax positions that require adjustment to the financial statements to comply with the provisions of this guidance. With few exceptions, NCLD is no longer subject to income tax examinations by the federal, state or local tax authorities for years before 2006, which is the standard statute of limitations look-back period.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE 990 IS PREPARED BY RSM MCGLADREY, INC., REVIEWED BY THE FINANCE DIRECTOR AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. A DRAFT COPY IS PROVIDED TO THE TREASURER OF NCLD BY EMAIL.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EACH MEMBER OF THE NCLD BOARD AND STAFF IS REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A FORM STATING WHETHER THEY HAVE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST REGARDING NCLD. THE FORMS ARE GATHERED ANNUALLY BY THE EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT, REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND MAINTAINED IN THE EXECUTIVE OFFICE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Policy and Process for Determining Compensation of NCLD's Executive Director includes all of these elements: (1) review and approval by the board of directors of the Organization; (2) use of data as to comparable compensation; and (3) contemporaneous documentation and recordkeeping. 1. Review and approval The compensation of the person is reviewed and approved by the board of directors executive committee of the Organization, provided that persons with conflicts of interest with respect to the compensation arrangement at issue are not involved in this review and approval. 2. Use of data as comparable compensation The compensation of the person is reviewed and approved using data as to comparable compensation for similarly qualified persons in functionally comparable positions at similarly situated organizations. 3. Contemporaneous documentation and recordkeeping There is contemporaneous documentation and recordkeeping with respect to the deliberations and decisions regarding the compensation arrangement. Policy Approved by the NCLD Board of Directors on June 15, 2009

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: NCLDs annual financial statements are included in our annual report which is posted online on our website. Governing documents and conflict of interest documentation are available to the public upon request. Our website provides a link to Guidestar, which provides information to the public, including 990s.
THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTION OF INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANTS.
